case.state:
{haiku}To observe some sights,
even I venture outside...
occasionally.

{haiku}Pursuing what's true
I find myself here today,
in this den of lust.

{haiku}A contest of luck
without winners or losers;
might be amusing.

A little card game...
Interesting proposal.
Who knows what might pass?

{haiku}Lone, lost sunflower,
will you survive without light?
Oh, so far from home!
Oh, huh... Now this is interesting...
Oh, my! You look almost like...

A fish? No, wait, she is just wearing a costume.
{haiku}Disguised as a fish
what secrets are you hiding
behind your faade?
Oh, a familiar face? I have traveled so far, and yet I find myself across the usual sights...

{haiku}Five of us, gathered:
unlikely congregation.
The game may begin now.

{haiku}Today's strange playmate
far beyond its habitat
it's a butterfly!
{!reset}How did you even get here, I wonder?

Oh, a butterfly happened to join us?
{haiku}Carried by the winds
no serious contender;
no clothing to shed.
{!reset} Still, it is pretty enough to warrant a spot, I'd say.
Alas, there are only women at this table, Misty. But it would be a shame if you left just because of that...
Fitness routines? Even in a place like this, I can't evade the dreadful prospect of exercising...
Hm... Not bad, not bad at all. You certainly have a good eye for imagery, Binah; if this is your first attempt at haiku, it is far above others I have seen.

Oh, hello Rhajat! I wasn't aware you were going to come here, too.
{haiku}Lucky happenstance,
to reunite with a friend
in a place like this.
Naked from the start? That seems against the spirit of the game...
No clothes? Frankly, ~player~, I think it would be more humiliating if you started with eight layers, and lost them all on purpose...

{haiku}Let's commence the game
and throw caution to the winds,
just our clothes at stake.

{haiku}A new beginning:
unknown world, unknown party;
unknown prospects, too.
So, uh, can I get two more cards too, dealer? No? Ah, then I'll swap ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.

{haiku}The end is in sight;
armed with ~cards.text~ new ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, dealer,
this duel shall start.
These are satisfactory. I have no need for more.
If I swapped these, the quality of my hand would only be lower. Hardly a desirable result.
I'll keep what I have, thank you very much.

{haiku}It would be hubris
to aim for more when you have
perfection at hand.

{haiku}I have all I want,
why overreach out of greed?
Zero cards, this time.
I already possess all that is necessary. No extra preparation will be needed.

{haiku}To reach perfection
with no input from my part...
Supernal, indeed!
It's rare that I am satisfied from the first version of one of my poems. But sometimes you end up changing it for the worse, so... I won't switch any of my cards.
I shall stay as I am; I don't want to overreach in pursuit of a lofty, unreachable goal... Better is the enemy of good, after all.
I only need to surpass one of you, yes? Then this hand is suitable enough, without any changes needed.
Wait, it's my turn to switch already? Uhh, let's trade... all of them. Yes, five cards.

{haiku}Dire circumstances
call for desperate measures:
I shall swap five cards.

{haiku}Alarming prospects
If I keep any of this;
I'll swap the whole hand.
I need to scrap the whole hand if I want to stand a chance of not losing...
This hand is simply worthless, dealer. I would like a new one, please.
Frankly, none of this is worth keeping... five cards, please.
Sometimes, things can be unsalvageable... not only poems, but poker hands, too. I'll need a new one...
In times like this, instead of trying to improve what is there, it's better to throw it all away and start anew. Five cards, dealer...
Not a single pair? Ah, just swap all of them...
My, this hand is remarkably terrible! Not a single card of it is worth keeping...

{haiku}This hand is quite close;
no revolution needed.
Just one card should do.
Hmm... for this hand, a very light touch is needed... I'll swap this one, dealer.
This is pretty good already, but it could become even better... One card, please.

{haiku}Sweeping, sudden shifts
sink more ships than they salvage;
a single card, please.
Huh? Oh, sorry, I was distracted... I'll change ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
(Maybe I should aim towards a bad hand... No, I shall let fate keep its course.) Dealer, I request ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.

{haiku}My hand needs some growth
so dealer, I ask of you:
please grant me ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ this time, dealer.
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ will hopefully improve my hand.
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, please.
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ should work. Probably. Maybe. I'm hardly a poker expert, after all.
I think I should be fine with ~cards.text~ new ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.

{haiku}This hand could improve,
but for that, dealer, I'll need
you to switch these ~cards.text~.

{haiku} Keeping this, I see
troubles on the horizon;
I shall seek ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
A poet's eye helps to appreciate beauty anywhere, but to discern the correct play, a gambler's eye is needed... ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, I think?
No haiku this time. Just ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, if you will.
Let me think... ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.

{haiku}To prevent my loss
sacrifices must be made
I'll exchange these ~cards.text~.
Oh, is it the next round already? Give me ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, then.
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~... I hope they are lucky.
I'm more used to fixing haiku verses than poker hands, but I think these ~cards.text~ should go.
Hm... I think these ~cards.text~ are the most disposable.
Each hand, five cards... it feels like rewording a complicated haiku, almost. Oh, I'll have ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.

{haiku}The weak must be culled
for the strong to truly thrive;
these ~cards.text~, I shall swap.

{haiku}In my time of need,
Seeking a better outcome
I require ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.

{haiku}If I ask for ~cards.text~
will I survive one more round?
Only time will tell.
Just give me ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, dealer.

{haiku}Back against the wall;
how many should I ask for?
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ should work fine.
Although it may be unavoidable, I'd rather try to stay in the game as long as possible. ~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ should work towards that end.
Hmm... this hand needs some finishing touches. I'll have ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, dealer.
I think asking for ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ would be the correct move, here.
Keep what works, discard what doesn't... In this case, ~cards.ifplural(these|this)~ ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.

{haiku}Cards that come and go,
a whirlwind of hopes and dreams;
I'll let go of ~cards.text~.
I almost wish the hands were ranked depending on their aesthetic merits, rather than how it currently is... Oh, right, I'll swap ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
Hmm... No, this doesn't quite work... Oh, right, cards! Let's trade back ~cards.ifPlural(these|this)~ ~cards.text~...
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, dealer. I hope these are better...

{haiku} My destiny lies
in mere pieces of paper;
symbols and numbers. {!reset}
Oh, and I will swap ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
I should aim for a pair, at the very least... Let's give back ~cards.ifplural(these|this)~ ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, then.
Ah, the endless pursuit of excellence... Every turn, a new challenge! This time, the answer shall be ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
To rely on divine blessing in a mere game of cards would be squandering such power... ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, dealer.
This periodic repetition of acts... it's almost a ritual of sorts. This time, I shall exchange ~cards.text~.

{haiku}Chosen by fate's whims
a poet, turned duelist:
I'll bring this game's end!
Father is always telling me: "Fortune favors the diligent, Mitama". Looking at these cards, I don't think he's right at all...
I can hardly call myself a poker expert, but at the very least I know when I have good cards. How about you, ~player~?

{haiku}Inspiration struck
a fleeting moment captured
in a paper's folds.

{haiku}A haiku's maxim:
What's good, if brief, two times good;
if bad, not as much.

As a poet, it is my duty not only to write poems, but also to educate those who wish to enter the world of haiku. Watching someone who was a total inept be able to compose a truly moving poem is very satisfying.
If fate keeps bringing me hands like this one, victory may end up becoming a reality... an amusing prospect, isn't it?
It's hard to attain perfection in the first try, but these are pretty close.

{haiku}Fortune smiles on me
and heaps her ample blessings
someone else will strip.
I must admit, I am getting quite caught up in the game. More enjoyable than playing for money, that's for sure.
Haiku poems might be short, but that doesn't mean crafting one is easy. Every word must be carefully considered!

{haiku}Armed with only cards
us fighters shall fiercely clash;
one must always fall...

{haiku}Luck is on my side,
a divine intervention?
If so, I am blessed.
I may have lost my gloves, but I still have a couple of tricks under my sleeves...

{haiku}Much have I labored,
much have I lost; this hand is
a welcome respite.
I could hardly call myself a combat medic if I couldn't handle a bit of pressure, could I?
I must say, I am not fond of the vapid exchange of pleasantries that social gatherings devolve into. This feels much more genuine, by comparison.
Just when Nohr and Hoshido settled their differences, they had to wage war again against their mutual foe... must the fighting never end?
Not only the contents of a poem must be carefully measured; the calligraphy needs to be suitably graceful, as well.
I bet Soleil would have a great time flirting with all the girls here. I will probably invite her next time I come.
If Nina ever came here... she would probably faint, with all the men getting naked together...
It's not often that I find myself in the company of so many people... I miss the quiet, somewhat.
Tsk... I can't come up with anything...
Few things can compare to the joy of taking a midday nap. You should try it for yourselves.
It's unlikely that you can grasp perfection on your first try. That's why it's important to keep writing.
I better write down some of the haiku I have come up with. I always forget them otherwise...
It is not often that I have to settle for mediocrity.

{haiku}Much like life itself
card games rely on one's hand
more than one's choices.
It is said that a picture is worth a thousand words... And yet, a truly skilled poet needs but seventeen syllables to recreate one.
You never know when and where inspiration will strike... That's why I make sure to carry brush and paper anywhere I go.
I prefer napping at my own room, but as long as I have my pillow with me, anywhere is fine. Once, I ended up sleeping at the prison, even.
These... could use some improvement. Alas, I don't have the chance to do so.

{haiku}Just a pair of cards;
with no major surprises,
it will be enough.
Hmm... nothing to write home about. Or, at all.

{haiku}Creating from aught;
that would be remarkable
were I capable...

{haiku}Think you know my hand?
Everything I say could be
nothing but a bluff...
I tend to strive for perfection, but I find myself a bit pressed for time here...
Hmm... I hope fortune plays nice this time.

{haiku}How much is enough?
The answer to that question
is, hopefully, this.

{haiku}Leaving all to fate;
what exhilarating ride!
I am but a fare.

{haiku}We can't help but play
life itself, a game of cards:
winners and losers.
Fate can be quite tricky. It is immovable, but it can also be quite difficult to predict... Sometimes you don't know what will happen until the very moment it occurs.

{haiku}One more step of this
inscrutable path I walk;
I shall not stumble.

{haiku}I go for a walk,
gray skies beyond my window;
hoping for no rain.
I think this is the longest period of time I have ever spent exposed in this manner... Strange, how nudity has become little more than a transitory period.
Kings ranking over queens... so it's like Hoshido, at least in terms of succession.
In Nohr, men and women hold no difference when it comes to entering the throne. If this game followed that rule, it would be a bit more confusing.

{haiku}Fate is against me,
yet seeing the ambiance, I
can't complain too much.

{haiku}Must I always lose?
Although inexperienced,
I am not alone...
The more you write, the more proficient you become. Perhaps the same is true for strip poker...

{haiku}Armed with naught but faith
I await the foreordained;
a not so harsh fate.

{haiku}A four of a kind?
What an unprecedented,
yet convenient turn!

{haiku}Oh, how unlucky...
I may have to strip! Truly,
a tremendous loss.

{haiku}Surge of misfortune;
time for Mitama to think:
what should I strip next?
Just so that people know, I didn't bring my festal here. That means, if someone scraps their knee, or something like that, I'm not healing them.
*yawn* I'm a bit tired... maybe if I hadn't stayed up all night writing haiku... no, I can hardly miss my most productive moment of the day.

Most of what I write
is simply not good enough
and ends up scrapped.
Like this one poem. It doesn't even have the correct amount of syllables...
Back at the base, we share the chores, like cooking and such, among ourselves. Mother says it helps foster the bonds between us; I say it's really tiresome.
In addition to my poems, I also dabble in chigiri-e, an art form that consists in creating images with pieces of torn paper. Maybe I can find a use for these cards, after all...

People at the base keep waking me up all the time. It's always: "Mitama, there are injured people that need your attention!"; "Mitama, why are you asleep at midday?"; "Mitama, don't snore at the war council!" Sleep should be sacred!
Admittedly, these cards do have interesting designs... but that's about it.
Luckily, there is no money at stake in this game... I already spent this month's salary in writing paper.
I'm not terribly concerned about each and every little misfortune that befalls me. Luck tends to even itself out in the end.
Can I take a nap for a while? No? Oh well...
Yeah, my cards are just dreadful. So dreadful, in fact, that there's no point to even pretend they are not.
Hmm... the game would be pretty boring if I always won, wouldn't it? And besides, losing is hardly an unacceptable outcome...

{haiku}Is this bad karma?
Perhaps I am too attached
to worldly desires.
We are all victims of fate. Some of us simply accept it.
As of late, Father has been pushing me to get archery lessons, "so that I can defend myself properly". Can't he see I'm busy napping?

{haiku}This hand is a joke!
I can almost hear Father
laughing at my luck.
Sometimes I think of a great idea for a haiku, and then I become distracted and it vanishes, as if it never existed in the first place. Truly vexatious.
Somehow, I managed to make my hand even worse than it originally was...

{haiku}These cards are no good.
Unfortunate Mitama...
or fortunate you?
Now that I think about it, maybe I didn't have to take off my gloves. I could have left them on... and nothing else.
Well, someone will be happy with this.
Barring a miracle, it will be my turn next. Fortunately for me, I seem to attract miracles, so...
Losing here is all a matter of luck, and I am confident enough about my body to not be ashamed by nudity. If I had to read my old poems, though... now that would be embarrassing.

{haiku}Whatever comes next,
I shall peacefully await,
eyes fully open. {!reset}
That is the duty of a poet, is it not?
Sometimes I also have to heal the people who fight in the arena. It's non-lethal, true, but it's still so much effort... And all of it, over mere food.
Mother being connected to the royal families of both Nohr and Hoshido means I am, technically, royalty. But I'd rather dedicate myself to writing than deal with the court and its issues...
I'm afraid I dedicated too much time to writing down my haiku, and not enough to selecting the right cards.
My, the mood of this game is particularly blithe today... I shall accommodate my haiku accordingly.
Oh, me? I'm Mitama, haiku poet and dreamer... and combat healer, at least for the moment. It is nice to meet you all.
Oh my, that outfit's backside is even more revealing than the front...
I'm pretty sure that's just cheating... why do you insist in prolonging the inevitable so much?
I must admit, I feel similarly attached to my writing implements. After using them for so long, my poems feel soulless if I write with anything else.
Oh, a gimmick? Well, since you two came to the game together, maybe you'll do the forfeit together, too?

Well, I don't keep a journal itself, but most of the haiku I write are about my experiences and feelings... {haiku}
To pour your own soul
not to people, but paper
is it strange, truly?
Oh, sometimes I cook for the army when it's my turn to do so. I'm actually pretty skilled at it, if I say so myself.
Hmm... I'm not too fond of weapons. If I were to choose something, it would be this brush.
Foo-rance? I have never heard of such a kingdom...
Conning people who need to be cured?! That would be... too heinous!
I once accompanied a ninja on his quest to retrieve a magical scroll from the ruins of a shrine. Long story short, by the time we arrived, the curse was already inert.
Oh, I do know someone like that... Selkie is always playing or jumping around. Honestly, it can be tiring to just watch her, sometimes...

Well, I see no point in concealing my interests, either.
{haiku}Poetry and naps;
innocent, joyful treasures:
what more could I need?
I have never taken anybody's life... and I hope I never have to. I am a healer, first and foremost.
Well, people always say I am lazy, but I tend to be either in the process of creating new haiku, or recovering my energy for what is to come. Does that fit your question?
While I'm not sure whether "tough" would be the correct word to use, Rhajat has proven herself to be far kinder than the rumors say. I highly treasure our friendship!

Well, I am a good cook... but, frankly, I don't see an auspicious future, were we to marry...
{haiku} Two lazy maidens
living under a shared roof?
Disaster beckons.

Personally, I prefer to keep it simple.
{haiku}Fresh-harvested rice:
Pickled plum placed over it,
heaven in a bowl.
I can't say, really. Insomnia has never been a problem for me. If anything, I struggle to stay awake...

For me, the stars are an endless source of inspiration... {haiku}
Stars in the night sky,
imperishable watchers:
do you cry, or laugh?

I very much doubt so, Takatoshi. The experiences we go through are what makes us who we are.
{haiku}In another world,
Mitama, not a poet?
Inconceivable!
Ah, gossip... in that regard, I would be of little help; I simply am not much of a social person.
Given your penchant for placing yourself at risk, I would say... hunter, or something along those lines.
All that work... so in the end, not even the gods can escape the rules imposed upon them by the universe. Somehow, that is reassuring.
Fortunately, I am unharmed. Although I do hope that Aimee doesn't plan on taking the rest of her clothes in the same manner...
Oh, you will take care of the healing, Fina? That's good; I wouldn't want to exert myself in my day off.
Well, um... when I was young, Mother used to hold my head on her lap and sing me lullabies... so something like that would be nice.

My closest friend is Rhajat... we just seem to instinctively understand each other.
I didn't think I could have such a meaningful relationship with another person!
Hmm... Ku-ma-to-ra. Four syllables, not too unwieldy. It's a beautiful name, so it would be a shame if it were truncated.

Personally, I can't think of a worse punishment than being forced to spend every moment embroiled in work.
{haiku}Pointless, endless chores
my soul slowly languishes,
buried underneath.
Huh... To find one's place in the world is perhaps the hardest task a person can undertake. Doing so is admirable, Taiyaki Girl.

{haiku} How loud is this crow,
mistaking its shrill cawing
for melodic song?

{haiku}Under the night sky
skyclad I find myself now.
Will you observe me?
Incidentally, by which manner did the rest of you arrive to this place? It was easy for me to go through the Dragon's Gate, but maybe it was more complicated for you.

{haiku}What gorgeous image!
Our naked bodies compete
with the moon's allure.

{haiku}An intimate match;
maybe we'll be cozier
just the three of us.
The moon is beautiful tonight, isn't it? Many haiku have been composed under the influence of a moon like this one...

{haiku}Soft grass grazes me,
nature and poet, as one;
a small but pure joy.

{haiku}Sandals discarded
I stand pleasantly barefoot
smooth sand under me.
Now that you can see all of me, I think it's only fair to show both sides. Which one do you prefer, hmm?

{haiku}For us defenseless,
victory and defeat hinge
on one last coin flip.
{!reset} Regardless of the outcome, this has been a truly enjoyable experience!

{haiku}Two trucks, having sex.
Such passion, I can't withstand.
Two trucks, having sex.

{haiku}Sleepin' in your bed
an imperceptible man.
Who you gonna call?

{haiku}Free will is a myth.
Religion is a cheap joke.
We are naught but memes.

{haiku}Think Three Houses rules?
How about a true good game?
Go play Fates instead.

{haiku}Surreptitiously
I opened one more time the
refrigerator.

{haiku}Time, human construct:
The past is far behind us,
there's no future yet.

{haiku}Oh, the misery...
everybody wants to be...
e, e, e, e, e.

{haiku}Subbing or dubbing;
eternal pointless debate:
no side will be moved.

{haiku}So many bodies
floating limp in the water
you can't recognize.

{haiku}You can't run, can't hide;
I am watching, behind you:
I live in your walls.
I must admit, it has become somewhat difficult to focus on the cards next to such a performance...
A ladies-only table? I had hoped for some more variety...
Now that I have come this far, I find myself a bit invested in the outcome of the game...
You have done great thus far... surely you can defeat a poor, lone shrine maiden?

{haiku}In terms of meter,
five, seven and then five more:
so a haiku goes.

{haiku}In the moonlit night
a friendly competition
no losers in sight.

{haiku} Doomed to lose, I wait
for the executioner
to lower its blade!
{!reset} Such powerlessness...
It's probably a good thing there are no familiar faces at this table. Imagine the awkwardness of the day after...

{haiku}By drawing my gaze
at the same sky of my youth
I felt I was old.
{!reset}I should write this down...
Wait, am I the only one here who doesn't shave down there? I wasn't aware I was in the minority in this regard.
Hmm... A secluded location like this... It gives this whole situation an air of mystery, don't you think?

{haiku}So many weapons
but none of them are for me:
a staff, all I need.
Did you know about the weapon triangle? Apparently, some weapons have an advantage against others... but I can never remember exactly how it goes.

{haiku}Sword and katana
side by side as companions;
reminder of home.
A library... strange place for a strip poker game. I wonder if they have haiku books...
The library back at the shrine was much more modest than this one. Hehe, I might even find a haiku book I haven't already read!
I wonder if I'll be able to stay here after the game for a while to read at my leisure. A week or so should suffice for some light reading.

This place is heaven to me: {haiku}
No park or meadow
can compete with the allure
of paper and shelves.
With how many books and poems I have at my room, it somewhat resembles this place... although here everything is much more orderly, I must admit.
So, whose birthday is it? Any of yours? It's not mine, that's for sure...
Wait, it is my birthday today! How did they know? Oh, there's even cake...
Spending this much time outside with so little clothing is not one of my usual activities... I hope I don't get sunburned...

Oh, but don't worry. After the game ends, I'll share my cake with everyone else.
{haiku}Far too much for one,
birthday cakes, just as birthdays,
are meant to be shared.
A library... strange place for a strip poker game. I wonder if they have haiku books...
The library back at the shrine was much more modest than this one. Hehe, I might even find a haiku book I haven't already read!
I wonder if I'll be able to stay here after the game for a while to read at my leisure. A week or so should suffice for some light reading.

This place is heaven to me: {haiku}
No park or meadow
can compete with the allure
of paper and shelves.
With how many books and poems I have at my room, it somewhat resembles this place... although here everything is much more orderly, I must admit.
I must say, the view here is simply gorgeous. Who knew a strip poker game could have such an amazing backdrop?
I would make for a dreadful ruler... I can't even keep my own room in order.

{haiku}O pitiful kings,
heavy is a crown's burden:
I'd much rather write.
A throne is not nearly comfortable enough for me... maybe with a couple of pillows?
After the game, we could huddle together in the sofa and watch the fire... It might be a bit small for all of us, but that only means we will be closer, don't you think?
It's still anyone's game... Who will claim the throne for themselves?

Throne aside, the view from this place is quite interesting... {haiku}
Through the stained window
an alternate universe;
strange, distorted hues...
something that reinforces that she doesn't have that much experience with men, or that she has more with women.
I don't see where that jealousy comes from... That vest covered you pretty well, too.
O-oh, truly? Well, thank you for the compliment... and I look forward to see you revealed, as well.
So we are both slightly dissatisfied by the present company. Shall we console each other, then?
So you want to keep all the men for yourself, Meia? How greedy of you...
Hm... rather than being driven into worship, I would say that I was born into it. With my father being a monk, and me being raised in a shrine, I didn't have much of a choice to begin with.

{haiku}A single purpose:
days without end, spent writing;
practice makes perfect.
{!reset}I simply have dedicated most of my life to haiku. Were I to match music to my words, I would probably have a harder time.

Inspiration from war? True; negative experiences can be the basis of poetry... but I'd rather write about more peaceful topics:
{haiku} With tired, sweating hands
amidst the raging maelstrom
I wish I were home.
I'm hardly a "warrior poet", Aloy. I am more of a "poet dragged into war"...
Hmm? What is a communion, exactly? I have offered food to the gods, but it's usually sake, not wafers...
No, not really. My haiku are just poems, not religious teachings. After all, proselytism would hardly be welcome in a strip poker game.

Human beings often find themselves befallen by catastrophes, or are simply left unsatisfied by their circumstances. If they could change their position, then obviously they would. It would be cruel to pretend otherwise.

I simply dedicate myself to what I find enjoyable: poetry. Is it truly so hard to comprehend?{haiku}
Another poor soul
trapped by productivity
my heart weeps for you.

{haiku}Do not confuse, Blake,
seclusion with loneliness;
I chose my few friends.
{!reset}As of late, I have managed to be at ease both by myself and with other people.

{haiku}A like-minded soul?
Trading both verses and clothes,
I shall play along.

There is more than poetry than just rhyming, Revy. But I suppose some people will never be able to appreciate such things...
{haiku}To poetry's flow,
some are as a newborn pup;
I pity such fools.
On the contrary, Jura, I find that mere observation of what is beautiful is not enough. By writing haiku, I can more effectively revere the elegance of the world.

Hm... Father does like challenging me, but, ultimately, he only wants me to do my best... regardless of how tiresome it is.
{haiku} Seeking excellence
for their offspring; is it not
a parent's nature?
Now that is an interesting question. Are you offering, perhaps, to take care of me yourself?
Well, being locked up isn't that bad... and, in any case, it wasn't to protect me from perverts... Besides, are you sure ~player~ is a pervert? ~player.ifMale(He|She)~ hasn't said anything yet...
Ah, I suppose my bra comes next... huh? What are you talking about, Blake?
While it is far too early to say for sure, I would not be opposed to such a thing. Who knows what will happen between us, hm?
Me, bored by poetry? That would be impossible, to put it plainly. And combined with the fact that I seldom have the chance to hear poems from others... I shall gladly hear you out, Miko.
Worry not, Reimu. Even if I did intend to take away your worshipers, I wouldn't follow you into your world to do so. Too much of a hassle, really.

It's all good. After all, we are here to enjoy ourselves, aren't we? And besides, it's hard to remain angry, looking at a cute face like yours.
{haiku}A sudden dark cloud
will not mar this sunny day;
it fades too quickly.
Well, I have simply followed the path that my attire mandated. But don't worry, Mari; you shall not be alone in undress for much longer.

Hmm... In that regard, it would seem that we stand as opposites. I started writing haiku for myself, as a way to palliate my loneliness; I suppose poetry is simply a more intimate art form than music.
Indeed, I am no ordinary shrine maiden. I am a poet, too; and as a poet, I cannot avert my eyes from the more vulgar aspects of humanity.
My type? I must admit, I have never given it much thought. Personally, I am more concerned with compatibility than appearances, in any case.
An oven? That is quite an outlandish method to conceive a new person, Caitlin...
Well, that is fine. After all, just your nude body will be inspiration enough...
I do not have much love for it, either. While I have met some good friends, I have had enough of the battlefield for a lifetime. But it is the course fate has set for me, and so I must walk it.

Well, I could never deny a request:
{haiku}Wielder of portents,
cutest of all alchemists;
a self-made woman.
Is that enough praise for you?
Ugh, discipline . No, thank you. I already have Father for that.
Oh, it certainly is comfortable enough to sleep in at the very least. As for the "traditional" part, it's pretty much your average Hoshidan shrine maiden outfit...

{haiku}In youth, loneliness;
I sought succor in poems,
catharsis through words.
{!reset} It's not a particularly happy tale, but it made me who I am today.

I concur.
{haiku}Poets whose roads crossed,
a prolific dialogue
is sure to follow.
I grew up in a Shinto shrine. Worship the gods, heal the injured, practice my poetry. An uneventful, yet comfortable existence.
It isn't particularly complex, but some of the training can be pretty rough... Learning how to heal, in particular, was exhausting.
We refer to them as "gods" in Hoshido, and I wouldn't consider myself chosen by them. I am but a servant.
I take it that you have ample experience in the matter, then? I must confess that despite my interest, I am not so knowledgeable about carnal topics.

Sure, why not? It could serve as a prelude of what is to come...
{haiku}Both worn out, I watch
as your chest rises and falls;
my world became you.
Indeed I am. But you seem to be no slouch at haiku yourself, Senko!

A request? It's not my usual method, but I'll acquiesce:
{haiku} From another world
she prances, and gold cascades;
pride in every step.
Oh, my favorite subject is flowers! For them, I'd even be willing to venture outside.
I aspire to be more acclaimed for my poetry than for my body... but I hope you enjoy it, nonetheless.

{haiku} Amid nude beauty
I stand; broadened horizons
beyond my four walls.
This game has certainly been enjoyable... and I look forward to its climax, Jura.
I'm not sure our ideals of beauty are exactly analogous, Jura. But you are right about the fighting, so I'll concede you have a point.
Hmm... I have had similar experiences, actually. The only artist I have come across while in the army is Shigure, and he is a painter.
But I am writing poetry about the game, Meia. You are just distancing yourself from it.

Haah... If only it were that simple. Shortly after birth, I was sent away to a safer Deeprealm... but then it was invaded by enemies anyway. And now, the safer place for me is my parents' army... so I must fight.
True, I like gazing at the sky... but the view from a spaceship must be completely different to what us see from the ground. Frankly, I am jealous!

Well, that is true. Not everyone is as blessed with words as I am. But I think you are selling yourself short, Meia; it's better to be blunt than to be so convoluted that others cannot understand you.
If you are as stimulating in bed as you are poem-wise, I would be a fool not to accept your proposal, wouldn't I?
Oh, is that so? And what would this worship entail? Provided that it's not too tiresome, I'm inclined to try...

{haiku}At some point, whether
sooner or later, harvest
blesses all alike.
Oh, did a muse appear before you? I would be more than happy to listen...
Well, Father always had strange ideas about the gods, despite being a priest himself. Perhaps some of them found their way to me.
W-wait... I have to t-take off m-my c-clothes? B-but the p-purity of a s-shrine m-maiden i-i-is s-sacred! Kyaaah! I c-can't do t-this!
Oh, it's my turn? After all this time, I was starting to feel sleepy...

Finally, my turn arrives.
{haiku}I'd almost been turned
from active participant
to mere observer.

{haiku}Reduced to a toy
in destiny's cruel jaws
an endless torment...
When failure is an inevitability, you become numb eventually.
I can't be too angry at this sequence of events... if anything, such a miraculous event baffles me.
Oh, I lost again. It almost feels like a foregone conclusion at this point...
Frankly, it's almost insulting to lose in this manner... Were it not for the promise that all but one of you will eventually be in the same predicament, I would have left already.

{haiku}Entangled by fate
I will never break the chain;
the strings that pull me.
I thought I understood the rules of this game. Clearly, I was wrong.
I don't even need to look at the cards anymore... I lost, didn't I?
Seems fate really wanted me to take off my clothes today...
I don't relish being the center of attention in this manner.
With so many consecutive losses, I won't be able to write anything!
Now I know how Setsuna feels after falling into a pitfall yet again...
But what if I simply discarded that adjective and... Wait, me again?
So much for beginner's luck...
Perhaps there is a rule I am not aware of yet...
Oh, two losses in a row. Well, that's the cost of inexperience, I am afraid.
It's not a very good sign for a poet to repeat herself...
If my bad luck is limited to cards only, then it is not such a heavy burden.
Ah, I couldn't expect too much of my poor, lone card.
My! I didn't think this would be a losing hand... I should readjust my expectations.

{haiku}Once again, a choice:
my armor, stalwart bulwark
is the answer now.

{haiku}Yet another loss;
this shrine maiden will soon be
just a nude maiden.
My turn again? Perhaps if I had inherited some of my mother's strategical prowess, I wouldn't find myself in this position. Then again, it probably doesn't translate well to cards...
Hmm... next is my bra. Were you waiting for this, perhaps?
Me? Hmm... what should I reveal first?
I have no more last-minute surprises... This time, I shall truly show myself...
My turn? I'll give you three guesses as to what I will take off. The first two don't count.
Ah, I lost. I suppose I could take off my hair ties, but at this point, that would just be needlessly cruel.
It might be a bit strange to wear a shrine maiden outfit to a place like this, but I have grown so accustomed to wearing it, it feels strange not to. Which part of it should I take off first...?

I might be a bit overdressed... What should I start with?
It's only fair that I show mine, don't you think?
Well, I can't get left behind...

Red and white are the traditional colors of the Hoshidan shrine maiden... The actual outfit may differ from one shrine to another, but you can identify us just by our appearance.

Right from the start, I am already behind? Hmmm...

Well, if nothing else, you are quick. However...
{haiku} Though soaring, your words
are as vacuous as air
and carry no weight. {!reset}
There is still plenty of time left.

Ah. Just an unprompted verbal assault, then.
{haiku}Unruly, rude child.
Did your father not teach you
not to taunt people?
Well, I shall rest a bit easier knowing you do not hold a grudge against me, personally. I might have asked what your "thing" was, but I'd rather not rub salt into the wound.

I see, I see...
{haiku}Poor Nagatoro,
turned into a deviant
by ~player.ifMale(his|her)~ heinous schemes...

{haiku}Such brazen praises!
You certainly waste no time
in airing your thoughts...

I can certainly commiserate with that. The key, I would say, is finding the right people to be with:
{haiku}With like-minded friends
without the isolation
you could get your peace.

Am I truly so undesirable, Nagatoro?
{haiku}Ruptured and sundered
by such a brusque refusal,
my heart gently weeps. {!reset}
Perhaps I should focus my attention towards others... ~player~, maybe?
Reimu, my poetry is the means through which I express my soul, not some bait for foolish visitors... Must you reduce everything to worshipers and donations?

{haiku}A warning, ignored;
unaware of my clothing,
how truly foolish...
Oh yes, by all means! But I shall warn you: I am a fairly strict critic...

Oh, of course!
{haiku}Like an endless spring,
my poems constantly flow;
fierce torrent of words.
{!reset} Though if you have a specific prompt...

For haiku, of course!
{haiku}A glimpse of the world
in a few words; poetry
in its purest form.
My, such a generous proposal! Do you extend it to every maiden you come across?
Hmm... to be more precise, I would like someone who doesn't annoy me, and whose company is pleasant for me. Although that doesn't narrow it down that much...
Well, yes, eventually. For now, everyone is still a bit too covered for that...

Most people are baffled by my habits, Meia. You are but another name in a long list.
{haiku}I seek only peace;
why do the others refuse
to live and let live?
Hmmm... well, power to them. I just don't see the point of swimming against the currents of fate.
Oh, but you don't need to worry. Recently, I find myself alongside more people that I know how to deal with; if anything, I crave the quiet now.
Given that I belong to an army, I am pretty much in constant demand... but I'd rather gain renown for my literary skills, instead.
Oh, it is fine to take this off; we are very far from the battlefield. And, well, I have to remove it before I move on to my other garments...

My, you certainly have a one-track mind, haven't you? And, well, I don't know that much about burial rites... dead bodies are viewed as impure, so the rituals concerning them don't take place at a shrine.
Danmaku battles? Is that how you wage wars in this Gensokyo of yours?
Hmmm... Father belongs to the army, and Mother is pretty much its leader... Yes, I suppose our situations are not too dissimilar.

True, I am still improving. And as long as I find joy in poetry, that's what really matters.
{haiku}Traipsing through the snow
I slowly ascend towards
a peak I can't see.
Actually, I have never been in such close contact with any deity before. You are the first one, Senko.
Then perhaps you would be willing to assist me when it's my turn to forfeit? Even if just with words, such aid would certainly be welcome.
To put it plainly, I don't think there can be any beauty in fighting. It should be avoided, not celebrated. Its only charm is its ending.
A world without flowers? That seems unthinkable... and rather sad, to be honest.
Hmm... I wouldn't say men lack beauty, Jura. They just have a different type of it. Less akin to a prairie, more similar to a rocky, imposing mountain.
Yes... I may direct my gaze towards the stars a bit more often after today. But for now, I hope you'll be looking at me instead.
Is that so, Jura? Then I shall reveal the next verse...
Well, I can't blame you too much for not paying close attention. I'm just removing my armor, after all.
Oh? That is not an unwelcome proposal. Do you have a plan in mind, then?
Men, huh? Well, compared to Father, I would say they are amenable, in the end. If you are worried about being too different, you should simply look for a man similar to you.
At times, my verses soar out of reach of the most fatuous of my comrades... It is somewhat disappointing, yet inevitable, in the end.

A haiku for Meia? Oh, sure:
{haiku} Quiet, piercing eyes
that consider every move;
exposed, yet reserved.

Another one? Well, I can't back down from a poetic challenge, can I?
{haiku}A lustrous, harsh sun;
impossible to ignore,
shining above all.
Oh, very interesting... It isn't often that I meet someone that can match me in poetry.
Huh... by how attached you are to your job, I had assumed you had been pretty much born into it. But in my case, I don't think I'll ever come to enjoy all this fighting.

Oh, the constellations should be similar in your home planet, compared to those of Earth!
{haiku}From a distant world
I see the old Pleiades
shining all the same.

Oh?
{haiku}Flame claims the young woods:
screams against the raging blaze,
prayers that it stops.
Nobody is born a poet, Mari. I would be more to happy to aid you in this subject, if you wish to learn.
Oh, is that true? And how do you intend to do so, Mari?

I wouldn't be opposed to a kiss, either...
{haiku} No matter which form
your affection takes, I can't
spurn such pure feelings.
Yes, it's a good thing we were able to mend our relationship. I must admit, I was guilty too... I can be a bit abrasive, sometimes.
Indeed, it's hard to keep grudges in a game like this. After all, our deeper selves are revealed in the process...
And also given the right company.
Yes, dreams may be just dreams, but that doesn't mean they can't come true, right?
And to think I was the only one with some shred of cover left... well, not anymore.
And so, the best was left for last...
I may have been slightly overdressed... let's correct that, shall we?
Strange for a haiku poet to be ahead of the curve...
As you can see, I'm not a very good poker player... but I compensate it in other ways.

{haiku}Nude by fate's decrees,
I strip not defeated, but
a leader, instead.
Huh, did you think I was a pure and innocent shrine maiden? Sorry to disappoint you, but if that were the case, I would hardly be here in the first place, wouldn't I?
Of course, wearing similar outfits helps reinforce the fact that we are equal in our worship of the gods...
I don't normally put too much effort in the way I dress. In that regard, my writing instruments take priority.
Thinking about it, can I really consider myself a shrine maiden after being away from the shrine for so long?

{haiku}I forgot my gloves,
lost in the moment's spirit.
Silly Mitama.
Being a medic, I'm not supposed to engage in combat. Still, things never go according to plan in a battle, so I appreciate the extra protection.
In any case, I'll take the whole dress off. It's just one piece, after all.
I tend to spend most of my time alone, just writing. Still, there are things best done in company, don't you think?
Let's just slide these off, and...
I think I'll start with my capelet. It helps keep my shoulders warm in winter, but it's probably my most disposable piece of clothing.

Woe is me! I have to show my breasts last!

I must admit, I do not pay much attention to fashion. My everyday outfit is comfortable enough to sleep on, whenever the need arises. That is sufficient for me.

Well, it's not the worst haiku I have ever heard. But its quality is sullied by your avarice, I am afraid:
{haiku}Free from impure thoughts
a poet's eye is needed
to see true beauty...
You are welcome. See, politeness isn't that hard after all, is it?
Not so fun being on the receiving end, is it?

{haiku}Never had I faced
such living contradiction:
both bashful and bold...
Oh? Hmm... It's a nice offer, but it will not be necessary. Just try to strip as naturally as you can.
Oh, forgive me, Tojiko, but I am simply unable to curtail someone else's poetic creativity... Besides, how long-winded can someone be in the form of a haiku?
Oh! Well, it's not a haiku, but it's not bad. Through your words, you let your spirit shine.
Hmm... I had never thought of writing a poem that encompasses the whole world. Then again, I've never had the opportunity to see it from above.
That is an admirable sentiment, Meia. You seem to be wise beyond your years.

But regardless of what that fate may be, we still have no choice, no?
{haiku}While man proposes
the gods dispose; I just want
an undisturbed nap.
Indeed. This little game just became much more interesting.
Indeed, Cheryl. You seem to understand the value of solitude well.
Well, strange as they may be, I cannot fault others for pursuing their passions. And burial is something all of us will be in need of, eventually.
Then I better take advantage of this chance! It is not often that I can talk about poetry to an equal, after all.
Oh, very much so. Politeness ought to be answered in kind, don't you think?
Oh, wonderful! Then I shall look forward to that moment.
True, this game might be a bit too short... Or perhaps you would prefer a more intimate environment, instead.
Honestly, whether I win or lose matters little to me: all I want to do is bask in the sights. So I hope someone else joins me soon...
Aren't you ashamed, ganging up on a poor shrine maiden like me?
I may be the closest to the forfeit, but you never know what fate holds in store...
And so, all my clothing is gone. It would have been a shame if I was the only one with secrets to hide, don't you think?
Since you can already see the front part of everybody else, let me show something different...

{haiku}Free from our trappings
we find ourselves united;
alike, after all.
And besides, if I untied my hair, I would have to tie it afterward. Too much of a hassle, really.
...Although regardless of our attire, some features irrevocably differentiate us.
To be honest, I doubt I would have come to a place like this had I never left the shrine. I was... secluded, in more ways than one.
Phew! I think I tied my armor a bit too tight this morning. Taking it off was a relief!
There are also some things you can only do with another person...
Nor am I a maiden anymore, for that matter...
The underwear I usually wear is more conservative than this. A special occasion calls for a special outfit, after all.
Despite having worn a sarashi for so long, I think I prefer these Nohrian undergarments... especially if I am to show them.

{haiku}I apologize
but my bra must stay for now...
till I lose again.
This is it. All of me, revealed in front of you. Feeling aroused already?
Don't count me out just yet. The game may end with all of you at my feet, if fate so desires.
I suppose I could have kept my gloves on, but what is done is done.
And here I stand in my underwear, much like some Nohrian fighters. At least I'm not in a battlefield...
Oh no my bare shoulders how lewd!
Any armpit enjoyers in the chat?
A shrine maiden's clothes must be carefully folded every time they are removed... they too, are sacred.

{haiku}Sing the wrath, goddess
of the man I am facing;
for he lost at cards.
Fortune is fickle, ~name~. Hardly something that can be relied on.
Your turn, ~name~. Better make it memorable.
Go ahead, ~name~, show us something inspiring.
No pressure, but I will judge you based on what you end up choosing, ~name~...

{haiku}Although you tried hard,
fate dictates it was your turn
It could not be helped.
The stage is all yours. How will you charm us, I wonder?
Surely a brave man like you won't miss the chance to show what he's worth to all of us, hmm...?
If you have an item that you just hate wearing, now you have a chance to get rid of it...
For a winner to exist, there must be a loser, too... such cruelty is inherent to life itself.
What's wrong, ~name~? Cold feet at this point in the game?
If you are unsure of what you should take off, I could make a couple of suggestions...
Victory may be fleeting, but it certainly is sweet.

{haiku}Much like the seasons
so this game turns; now show us
how well you adapt.

{haiku}Let go of your pride:
in this luck-driven contest
it's just a burden.
I never saw the point of being afraid of the inevitable. Losing is just another part of the game.
I would be lying if I said I wasn't looking forward to this...
Well, ~name~? What shall be my prize for enduring this round?
Hah... please be the underwear...
Since it's your fault I'm in this state... don't you think you should take responsibility, ~name~?
M-more... I want to capture every inch of your body...

Another loss, ~name~?
{haiku}Sitting here naked,
I hope you will join me soon
in this lust-filled ride...
Come on, ~name~. Surely you didn't expect to keep all your clothing until the end, did you?
You have been pretty lucky so far, but all must come to an end, ~name~.
Ah, to still have clothes to lose... You are most fortunate, ~name~...

{haiku}It's your turn to strip;
out of your many garments,
which one will you pick?
You're on, ~name~; time to make this game a bit more exciting.

{haiku}Bad fortune for you
time to take the center stage
and take something off.

{haiku}Regardless of skill
you find yourself the loser.
Blame fate if you must.

{haiku}Sympathy from me
you won't find; fate forsook you:
now you pay the toll.
I'm more used to giving offerings than to receiving them, so this makes for a nice change.

{haiku}Nothing is promised
whether victory or loss
all is down to chance.
I skipped nap time for this, ~name~. Better make it worth it.

{haiku}Your brave sacrifice
won't be lost; in a myriad
poems it will live.

{haiku}Sometimes you vanquish
sometimes you find yourself quelled
luck drifts just like that.
The cards are naught but the tool with which fate decrees whose turn it is; the true appeal of the game comes now...
New experiences are the lifeblood of a poet. Please do try to provide us with a striking image, ~name~.

{haiku}You made a misstep
Is it that I have made you
distracted, perhaps?
I have already taken off quite a bit, don't you think? Now it's your turn.

{haiku}Whatever you take
whichever way you take it
your loss is our gain.

{haiku}Victory is sweet
yet sweeter is the pleasure
from seeing you strip.

{haiku}Your options dwindling
another choice must be made:
what will it be now?

{haiku}Balk not, for there is
worth in the unfamiliar:
step forth, stalwart scout.

{haiku}Your loss is a chance
to become a muse for me:
you should be grateful.
I'm taking notes on what you choose. With that in mind, try to pick something interesting, please.
If I were you, I'd already know what to strip next. Surely it can't be that hard to choose?
Well, someone had to strip this round. The fact that you had the worst hand, ~name~, was purely coincidental.
Oh, it's your turn, ~name~. Did you plan beforehand what you would strip in each round, or do you let your whims lead you? Personally, I chose the former...
I would appreciate it if you put on a bit on a show, seeing the state I'm currently in...
Ah...~name~ will...

{haiku}Much like dry kindling
flame could quickly possess me
with all but a spark...

{haiku}Walk another step
forward into indulgence
and end just like me...
Play nice, ~name~, and maybe I'll repay your kindness, should you find yourself in the same predicament as I do.
Fate has given you a chance to make my wishes come true. Do not squander it, ~name~...
Oh, do you wish to match my attire, ~name~? I see no issue with that...
What they say to a female NPC who has lost a round
Don't be too disheartened, ~name~. Losing at cards hardly measures a person's true worth.

Oh, a tie happened!
{haiku}No one moves, in awe
of this bizarre stalemate;
a world, paralyzed.

{haiku}A tie? No one strips.
Did this round even happen?
Yet we shall move on.
A decent starting point. After all, it would hardly be becoming to show your genitals after your first loss.
Accessories are more commonly associated with women, aren't they? Still, men do wear some small things, too.
With so little to work with, not even I can compose a haiku out of it...
To see beauty in the commonplace... That, too, is the role of a poet.

{haiku}Art cannot be rushed;

{haiku}From your vantage point

Oh, how I wish someone would take care of me just like that...

Caressing yourself,

I wonder how hot would you body be, were I to touch it...
During my time in solitude, I got used to doing this by myself... but looking at you, I'm thankful I don't have to.
I wonder if men and women derive the same amount of pleasure from this kind of activity...
So free and uninhibited, even in front of all of us!
Do you have a particular inspiration in mind, ~name~? One of us, perhaps?
Ah, the way your gaze is starting to unfocus, little by little...
How blessed am I, to see a man melt before my own eyes...
I thought it would take some time to get comfortable... but once I began, no reluctance remained; only a deep, intense urge...
Since we are in the same circumstance, we should help each other... I could take care of you, and you could take care of me.
You are my first experience of a man doing this kind of thing, ~name~. But don't worry, you are far more than adequate.
Do you see how easily these fingers enter my body, ~name~? Imagine the possibilities...
A-ah... if only I could surrender my body to you, ~name~...
This may be but a prelude, ~name~. After the game, we could spend some more time just by ourselves...
Hah... I don't know where to direct my gaze. Towards your face... or lower, perhaps?

{haiku}With such company
isn't it a shame, to be
sitting by yourself?
Such brazen displays... I can't stop watching, even if I wanted to.
If some of your seed happens to spill onto me, don't worry too much. Such accidents are forgivable in the heat of passion.
Even if the feeling is not mutual, I cannot avert my gaze (or something like that)

{haiku} Helpless against lust
he spills his prized royal seed
on the barren floor...

{haiku} Helpless against lust
he spills his prized royal seed
on the barren moor...
Already done? Well, someone was eager...
And to think I have barely started to strip myself.

{haiku}Laid low by luck's whims,
you lay down satisfied, yet
thoroughly vanquished.
Oh, what a climax! Just at the right moment...
Oh, my! You have made quite a mess, haven't you?
You couldn't hold it a bit longer? Then we could have finished -hah- together...
Wow, that was a lot of... You really surpassed my expectations, ~name~!
Maybe the next time, instead of spilling your seed over yourself, you could share it with me...

A-ah...
{haiku} You arrived sooner
to our shared destination
I will soon come, too...
According to the rules of the game, we both lost... Still, you'll agree with me that it was the sweetest loss of your life, no?

{haiku}Thus the journey ends;
with your newfound clarity,
savor what remains.
Don't get cold feet now, ~target~... I want to see you in action.
You don't need to pretend you don't want to do this, ~name~. It's only natural, after all.
Subjected to fate's cruel whims, you will have to put on a show for us... how unlucky. Although, in your case, maybe I should congratulate you instead?
Don't fret, ~name~. After all, most of us will end up in the same situation as you, in the end.
Defeated so thoroughly by a mere shrine maiden? My, my...
I see you were in dire need of self-care, ~name~...

{haiku}You fought valiantly
yet you were defeated still;
relax and enjoy.

I shall derive no pleasure from your loss, for I am above such trivial matters.
Your body, however...
Ah... you'll join me, ~name~? You're welcome to seek inspiration by gazing at me...

{haiku}Having been bested
I see my foe fallen now
to my utter joy.
Sure, you might have lost, but there must be some part of you who wanted to do this, isn't there?
Well, if you were in such a hurry, don't let me stop you...
Go on, ~name~. Maybe I'll learn something new...
In a game of luck, losing is inevitable. But perhaps it could be more enjoyable than winning, even...

{haiku}So begins your fall
into mad debauchery;
but how will it end?
Ah... I am a bit ahead... but maybe you will be able to catch up, ~name~...

{haiku}A defeated foe
shall now become, for this task,
a welcome partner...

{haiku}The end's beginning
is inevitably here
how fast will it come?
I can only hope you enjoy it half as much as I did.
Ever been intimate with another woman before, ~name~? Maybe I could show you what it is like...
I hope that is as enjoyable as it looks, ~name~...
I can see why you were in such a hurry...
Strange punishment, this self-inflicted one...
Debasing yourself like that in front of a shrine maiden... have you no shame, ~name~?
I may not present the most enticing of images, but feel free to watch me if that helps you, ~name~.
I wonder, will you start slow, or seek release as soon as possible? I tend to the latter, but other people have their own preferences.
Ooh, you are really dedicated, huh? I still have some time before I join you... but you might be finished before I have the chance to do so.
Just out of curiosity, how deep can you go, ~name~?

{haiku}Next to such display,
everything else rings hollow;
the cards, forgotten.
Do you have a specific spot to aim for, or do you simply leave it to chance?
I'm getting flushed... no point to deny it anymore, I am being taken by lust.
Perhaps I should imitate how you do it, ~name~... maybe I'll learn something new.
Strange... I didn't think I would find myself in this kind of situation... and yet, I find it pleasurable...
Feel free to look as much as you want, ~name~... I'll take the opportunity to do the same.
I can't help but feel a strange sense of kinship between you and me...

{haiku}Overcome by lust
I gaze upon you, and find
a mirrored visage.
Ah... I don't need to do this alongside a partner... but it certainly helps.
It's all over now... Just relax and focus on what pleasures you.
I might be done, but ~name~ is just getting started...
With how happy you seem, I am almost tempted to go for a repeat myself...

{haiku}Like a volcano
warmer and warmer you get
until you erupt.
You get to masturbate while gazing upon my naked body... aren't you lucky, ~name~?
There is no wrong nor right way to do this, ~name~. Just do what feels good for you.
To think the simple action of caressing oneself can bring us such pleasure...

{haiku}Engraved in my mind,
maybe I shall see your face
in my dreams tonight...
All the pleasure that must be coursing through you... I'm almost jealous.
The sight of a shrine maiden, drenched in sweat and cum... enticing, is it not?
It is important to be comfortable with oneself... but you take it to another level, ~name~...
I tend to go slowly at first, then progressively increase the intensity of my touch... is that also true for you?
If there is anything you desire from me, ~name~, you need only ask, and I shall grant your wishes...
I already had plenty of excitement earlier... But seeing your face, you might be enjoying yourself even more than me!
The sight of a flushed woman, her body irradiating pleasure... I could never tire of it.
In the end, this is what we all wanted, is it not? To expose our deepest desires to someone else...

{haiku}To serve a goddess
not with prayers or offerings,
but with my body...
If this is what lies at the end of the game, I can't help looking forward to my turn...
Sooner or later, we will all reach the same destination as ~name~. She's merely a bit ahead of us.
My... I can feel myself growing warm, and yet my turn is still far...
Was the allure of lust too strong to resist, ~name~? Or did you never attempt to resist it to begin with?

{haiku}A match against lust
with such rousing company,
how long can I last?
Hah... we find ourselves at an impasse, ~name~. Who will give first?
Doing this alongside you, ~name~, fills my heart with warmth... For that, I must thank you.
What the character says while a female character is masturbating.
What the character says while a female character is masturbating.
What the character says while a female character is masturbating.
No aspect of nature can be discarded; anything and everything is part of a whole... Even the more obscene acts.
Nudity may be alluring, but this is what I truly wanted to witness in the end.

{haiku}With the goal in sight
how eagerly you explore,
deeper and deeper!
Huh, you were so quick, I almost missed it! Perhaps you should try again later, so that I won't miss anything...
Sorry, ~name~. You don't get any extra points for speed...

{haiku}A hurried journey,
we stand far; were you rushing
or was I dragging?

{haiku}Already finished?
I haven't even started;
yet somehow I feel...
The pitch your voice reached there was a poem by itself, ~name~...

{haiku}A fabulous sight:
as if from a flooded dam,
the cum freely flows...

{haiku}Exhausted, you lay
after reaching the summit;
superb performance.
That look on your face... you really gave it your all, didn't you?

{haiku}A piercing shout marks
the climax of the whole show:
the raw cry rings true.
Is it just me, or do you feel exhausted after climaxing, too?
Heh... you beat me, ~name~... but not by much...
Hmm... you couldn't hold it even one more second, ~name~?
Hah... if I had any lingering doubts about forfeiting, they have been completely dispelled by that lovely expression of yours...
Me first? Very well, I shall set an example.

{haiku}I was almost there,
yet fate chose you in the end.
Congratulations.

{haiku}A plunge into bliss;
a profound stimulation,
I'll fully give in.
Luckily, I have my pillow, trusty companion, to call for aid. Let me get comfortable...
So many men, and only one of me... Whatever shall I do, in a situation like this...?
Oh, are you curious? Do you wish to gaze at myself? Perhaps you could even provide assistance...
What's with that gaze? Have you perhaps, discovered something new? Well, the more you know...

{haiku}What am I to do?
Will I prolong this pleasure?
Or give in to bliss?
If I was at your complete mercy, what would you do to me, ~player~?
Isn't this what you wanted? To see a shrine maiden defile herself? To succumb to pleasure? To scream in ecstasy?
Usually, I do this in silence. However, since I am in company today, I'll put on a bit of a performance...
If I can get this excited by myself, imagine how you could make me feel, ~player~...
Normally, I use this pillow to take a nap wherever I wish. I will have to remember to clean it when I get back...
I tend to keep my haiku to myself. In a sense, this is the first time I am performing for others... so I hope you enjoy it.

{haiku}Sitting by myself
I miss a companion's warmth:
my body wants yours.

{haiku}Passion unleashes
a torrent of emotions;
I am swept away.
Pleasurable as it is, masturbation is such a selfish activity... I'd much rather share this joy with someone else.

{haiku}Light as a feather,
just from this gentle caress
I become aroused...

{haiku}I walk this lone path
and as my body grows weak,
my voice becomes song...
This might not be the purest of acts, but it is truly pleasing... perhaps, in part, due to its taboo nature.
I must admit, the atmosphere is not quite as propitious as it could be... but I'll make do with what I have.

{haiku}Though I don't need it,
assistance would be welcome...
a better view, please?
O-oh, f-fuck!
Haah... it seems words have left me...
Not... m-much longer...
I'm a-almost...
Hnrrgh...
I am making... such undignified noises... b-but I need it...
N-no... I can't hold myself... I d-don't want to!
Y-yes, that's it! O-ooh!
Whew, what a rush! I'm starting to get slightly drowsy...
Heh... I always get tired after doing this... today was no exception...
I wonder if this counted as exercise... I did end up working a sweat, heehee.
Maybe I should I have tried to prolong it... but I always get so excited, I end up losing control...
Doing it in front of an audience... went pretty well, actually. I'll probably do it again sometime.
That was so intense... I will need some time to get my thoughts in order...
*yawn*... This game is taking such a long time... I think I'm going to take a quick nap...

Ah... I really needed that nap...
{haiku}From a deep slumber
the poet's mind wakes refreshed:
and rising, takes flight.
As you just saw, I have the ability to fall asleep anywhere I wish. It's one of my best qualities, if I say so myself.

{haiku}An awakening:
to briefly stand between dreams
and reality...
This nap wasn't long enough to form any coherent dreams... but that is fine; my current situation surpasses any oneiric imagery I could conceive.
While I sleep, my dreams are indistinguishable from reality. It is only when I am awake that the illusion is dispelled. Could life itself, too, be nothing but a dream, then?
Ah... I often take naps outdoors, but this is the first time I have done so while nude. A pleasant experience, I must say.
I may have lost, but that was fun. Wait, if I had won, I wouldn't have been able to relieve myself, so maybe it was a good thing I didn't?
After the game, I'm locking myself in my room for a week. I have much to write about...
Normally, I would be taking a shower at this point. I suppose I will have to stay sticky a bit longer...
And to think I will have to return to the dull routine of training and chores after this...
Hmm... tomorrow, I'm on cooking duty. People always praise my meals, but I spend so much time making them when I could be writing instead...
So many haiku in so little time... This has certainly been a productive day!
Thank goodness I no longer have a hand to worry about! Now I can write to my heart's content...
An experience like this is truly unique... I doubt I will ever forget these feelings...

{haiku}From this adventure
I gained the perfect treasure:
a new perspective.

At this point, I can't lose anymore... all that I have left is observing and writing.
A fitting role, isn't it?

{haiku}I may have prevailed,
yet I could not spoil myself.
It's almost unfair...

{haiku}Victory is mine!
But I barely broke a sweat...
What did just happen?

{haiku}It went by so fast...
Is it over already?
But I have yet to...
I had already seen my defeat as a given, since it's the most common outcome... And yet, fate surprises me with a win.
Ah, I won, but now I am all alone... Perhaps some kind person shall walk me home gently?
Meaningless though that may be, I find myself the winner... But what is my reward?
And so the game ends, with my modesty kept almost fully intact. This is a bit anticlimactic...
Haiku GET
O-oh, the game is over? Oh, uh, congratulations, ~winner~...

{haiku}Strengthened by a friend
the bold warrior stands alone;
his foes, defeated.
Well, you won, Binah. I suppose I must congratulate you. And yet, you stand, with your desires unfulfilled... perhaps I could assist with that?
In the end, winning was the more unexpected move you could pull. Well played, Bobobo.

{haiku}What I most enjoy;
a show, poems and a nap:
an excellent day.

{haiku}In a naughty place,
a brief, yet pleasant sojourn,
I leave satisfied.

{haiku}Although a novice
to such a game, I was charmed;
I shall soon return.
Haiku GET
*yawn* Ah, the game is still going? Must have been a short nap, then...
Zzzzzzzz...
Zzz...zzz...
Zzz...*snore* zzz...

{haiku}Lying down, I watch...
today's clouds slide to the right...
I truly am free...

{haiku}Haiku without end,
imperishable poet...
asleep, still I write...

{haiku} With closed eyes I see,
Elysium in the dream...
no turmoil, just peace...

{haiku} War, a paradox...
If no one calls for it, why?
Why must it return?

{haiku}We all need safety:
In the rough sea, a lighthouse
poems in the fog...

{haiku}In the darkest night,
a light parts the sky; go forth,
shining shooting star...

{haiku}I extend my hand
towards the most precious gem:
a full moon above...

{haiku}The birds fly back home
black kites over the sunset...
But who chases them?

{haiku}Fog rolled; all I see
is an endless blank expanse:
beauty painted white...

{haiku}As the days go by
I leisurely only write;
is this happiness?

{haiku}A transient respite
under a blanket of stars,
such good company!

{haiku}Glacial solitude;
time flows, yet I stay and watch
this world, unmoving.
